page.title: 05Law And Order In Cleobury
page.content: In Cleobury there is a Police Station which is un-manned because we don't get much trouble here. It has got two constables, P.C. Cadwallader and P.C. Carpenter and Sergeant Evans. These people pop in occasionally to see that things are all right. We are in the Bridgnorth rural area. There is also a Magistrates' Court in Cleobury which meets on the first Friday of every month. The court sits in the library and, when it meets, the bookshelves are pushed against the wall. Above the court chairs there is a coat of arms, which tells us that the court is in the Queen's service. There is a Juvenile Court for children over 11 and under 17. This Court meets on the last Friday of every month. There are four magistrates who sit at each session.
